sentences.en: Finally, It'sounds trite but the secret really is to keep talking.
sentences.cn: 最终, 改善关系的秘密听起来俗套但是的确在于不断交谈.

sentences.en: He had something to prove, something that would sound trite if it were put into words.
sentences.cn: 他已经证实了一些东西, 一些如果讲出来听将会是很平凡的东西.

sentences.en: Her remarks sounded trite and ill-informed.
sentences.cn: 她的话听起来没有新意，信息匮乏。

sentences.en: His remarks were trite and commonplace.
It costs not trite than 50 dollars.
It was spiritual, but it wasn't trite.
sentences.cn: 但是她爱他是精神上的, 决不是俗套.

sentences.en: It'sounds so trite, so Norman Vincent Peale, but my goodness this works.
sentences.cn: 这听起来是如此陈腐, 和诺曼.文森特.皮尔一样.

sentences.en: That was true no matter how trite It'sounded.
sentences.cn: 这种话听起来像是陈词滥调,不过,这是真话.

sentences.en: The movie is teeming with obvious and trite ideas.
sentences.cn: 这部电影充斥着平铺直叙的陈腐观点。

sentences.en: The story is described as beautifully written but concerned with the trite theme of adolescent loneliness.
sentences.cn: 人们认为这本小说写得很美,但内容却是有关青春寂怨的这个老一套的主题.

sentences.en: The trite objects of human efforts -- possessions, outward success , luxury -- have always seemed to me contemptible.
sentences.cn: 至于那些老生常谈的人生目标,诸如物质占有 、 功成名就 、舒适享受等等, 在我看来都不值一顾.

sentences.en: There is a world of accumulated feeling back of the trite dramatic expression -- " I am going away. "
sentences.cn: 那句富有戏剧性的 老话 " 我要走了 " 的背后,蕴藏着无限的情感.

sentences.en: This would seem so trite as to need no further elaboration.
sentences.cn: 这全是老生常谈,无需多加发挥.

sentences.en: Yesterday, in the restaurant , Lorraine had seemed trite , blurred, worn away.
sentences.cn: 昨天在饭店里,洛兰显得庸俗 、 堕落 、 衰老了.

sentences.en: You reject everything that is garish and trite.

words.tran_cn: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的

trans.tran_cn: （言语、想法等）老生常谈的，陈腐的，老一套的
trans.tran_en: a trite remark, idea etc is boring, not new, and insincere
